note.p: Career: Went to Bombay as a writer in the HEIC (1765); Private Secretary to Col. Keating and accompanied the expedition to assist Regoba, regarded as rightful Pescwar of Mahrattas (1775); Collector and Resident at Dubhoy (1780); left India (1784); imprisoned in France (released 1804); published "Letters from France" (1806) and "Oriental memoirs" (1813-1815)
References: G R de Beer, 'The Relations between Fellows of the Royal Society and French Men of Science when France and Britain were at War' in NR 1952 vol 9 pp 244-299
